THRISSUR

Thrissur is a district in the central part of Kerala, known for its cultural, religious, and natural diversity. It is a place where you can experience the heritage, festivals, and cuisine of Kerala, as well as enjoy the scenic hills, forests, and waterfalls. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Thrissur district that you can visit:

Vadakkunnathan Temple: This is one of the oldest and famous shrines of Lord Shiva that can be found in the Thrissur district of Kerala. The temple has a collection of beautiful mural paintings, some of which are more than 400 years old. The temple is also the venue for the Thrissur Pooram, a grand festival that attracts thousands of devotees and tourists every year. The temple is a fine example of the Kerala style of architecture, with a circular sanctum, a multi-tiered roof, and a gopuram

Shakthan Thampuran Palace: This is a historical palace and museum, built by the ruler of Cochin, Ramavarma Thampuran, in 1795. The palace is a blend of the Kerala and Dutch styles of architecture, and has a spacious courtyard, a garden, and a pond. The museum displays various artifacts, paintings, weapons, and coins related to the history and culture of Thrissur. The palace is also known as Vadakkekara Palace, and is a protected monument

Basilica of Our Lady of Dolours: This is the largest and tallest church in India, and one of the most prominent landmarks of Thrissur. The church is dedicated to Our Lady of Dolours, and has a Gothic style of architecture, with a triple tower facade, stained glass windows, and mural paintings. The church also has a museum, a chapel, and a cemetery. The church is also the venue for the Feast of Our Lady of Dolours, which is celebrated with great fervor and devotion

Athirapally Waterfalls: This is one of the most spectacular and popular waterfalls in Kerala, located 60 km from Thrissur city. The waterfall is formed by the Chalakudy River, and plunges down from a height of 80 feet, creating a misty and majestic sight. The waterfall is surrounded by dense forest, and is home to various species of birds and animals. The waterfall is also a popular spot for film shooting, and has been featured in many movies
